Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

Abstract
Jun-ying Tang, Wei-guo Zhou, Rui-tang Guo, Chun-ying Huang, Wei-guo Pan , Enhancement of photocatalytic performance in CO2 reduction over Mgg-C3N4 catalysts under visible light irradiation.The address for the corresponding author was captured as affiliation for all authors.Please check if appropriate.Catcom(2018),
Experimental

recorded in the range of 250-800 nm on a spectrophotometer (SHIMADZU UV-3600, Japan) using BaSO 4 as the reflectance standard material.Photoluminescence (PL) characteristics were analyzed with an excitation wave length of 325 nm at room temperature using a fluorescence spectrophotometer (Hitachi F-4600). CO 2 photocatalytic reduction was typically performed in a gas-closed circulation system by using a reactor (volume: 500 mL) purchased from Perfect Light Company (China, Beijing).The reactor was made of

The as-prepared MgpCN photocatalysts exhibited enhanced photocatalytic activity for the reduction of CO 2 to CH 4 and CO under illumination.Based on the above characterization and analysis results, the enhanced photocatalytic performance was mainly attributed to the restrained recombination of photogenerated electron-hole pairs.The possible reaction mechanism on the MgpCN catalysts is discussed as schematically presented in Fig. 4. Upon light irradiation, H 2 O molecules are oxidized by h to generate H and

oxidized by h to generate H and HO on the VB of MgpCN catalysts.Meanwhile, due to the fact that the Fermi level of magnesium is lower than that of pCN and the heteroatom magnesium may act as the photogenerated electron target 22, the electrons on the CB migrate to magnesium dispersed on the pCN surfaces and the CO 2 molecules are reduced to CO and CH 4 under the assistance of H .Obviously, this contributes to the separation of electron-hole pairs and results in photocatalytic activity improvement.In

result.query:
Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
Light_source: XXX
Lamp: XXX
